meanings.definition: Opposed to or against reason or rationality.
meanings.sent1: The antirational decision to jump off a cliff without a parachute was very dangerous.
meanings.sent2: Her antirational behavior made it difficult for others to understand her actions.
meanings.sent3: It was quite antirational for the cat to try to swim in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury seemed almost antirational, with wind and rain lashing out unpredictably.
meanings.sent5: The antirational belief that stepping on cracks would break your mother's back stuck with him since childhood.

meanings.definition: A person or group that rejects or opposes rational thought or reasoning.
meanings.sent1: The antirational refused to listen to any logical arguments.
meanings.sent2: The antirational in the group always caused disagreements with their unconventional ideas.
meanings.sent3: The antirational at the party insisted that wearing socks with sandals was the height of fashion.
meanings.sent4: She saw the world through antirational lenses, always questioning the status quo.
meanings.sent5: The antirational's presence in the debate added a touch of chaos to the otherwise orderly discussion.
